column4: hey guys... i got a 250gb hdd... what should i format it too? whats the best format for using it constanly like media wise?
That depends... are you going to be using it on other operating systems (such as windows) or just linux machines?
just linux machines
well then ext3 would be a good choice... although, I personally perfer reiserfs, but you may need to install the drivers for that
whats the difference?
I prefer reiserfs mostly because it doesn't require that periodic filesystem check on boot
ohhh
also, some benchmarks say that its faster
ok well ill format it that... and why do i need drivers?
Because it may or may not be installed by default.. On my machine (Linux mint) its already installed, but i don't know if it is by default on ubuntu
to install it just type in a terminal: sudo apt-get install reiserfsprogs
i already have it i think in the partition editor it says i can format it to that
okay, then you should be good to go
nice thanks
do you know how to make a trash can on a ntfs partition? cuz it says i can only perm delete when i hit delete
Not off the top of my head...
ok
other patitions use a .Trash-[uid] folder
whats the [uid] ? i might be able to make one
its your user id # (usually 1000 for the first user on the system)
and will that work if i put it there?
but simply having that folder won't make it use it as a trash folder
ohh
